alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:26AM EST until January 12 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Connecticut... Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting New London and Washington Counties. For the Pawcatuck River...including Westerly...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawcatuck River at Westerly. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Floodwaters approach lowest lying homes along Hiscox Road in Westerly. Along Route 3, flooding occurs at some homes in French Village in Hopkinton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage due to tidal effects with a maximum value of 7.6 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
